channel.title: Teleporting Aliens
channel.description: I was watching Freeman's Mind a few days ago when Ross mentioned aliens teleporting inside of people. I think that would be interesting to see. So I wonder if anyone could give me a description on what that might look like. This is just something to dwell on. Nothing serious.

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.description:
think of how unlikely aliens would randomly teleport perfectly onto the floor, and not in the middle of it, or inside a wall, or any of the millions of objects in the environment, which is what they do in the game. teleportation in the game doesn’t make sense. half of the things in the game doesn’t make sense. the best you can do is to just replicate what happens in the source material and call it a faithful adaption.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: m4rek
item.description:
Shush you; you haven’t been discovered yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
It’s impossible because of Newton’s 4th (secret) law, which states: “Aliens cannot teleport inside humans. They also cannot open doors.”

The law is so secret that only I know about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: m4rek
item.description:
But if you exceed electron degeneracy pressure, you can get more stuff in the same space… Exceed neutron degeneracy pressure, you’ve got problems. Singularity problems.

But that’s a bit irrelevant. If you were to instantaneously materialise nucleon in that space, the other nucleons would be pushed away from it. So teleporting something into something else; your something else would expand, and if not able to do so, explode.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
you know it

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Raminator:

The nuclear force in between those atoms prevents their nuclei from occupying that “empty” space.

I was gonna say that yesterday, but I couldn’t think of a good way to word it. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: Spooboy
item.description:
Losmoges:

Actually…

Question:
What happens when two things teleport into each other?

Answer:
[pic here]

Inspiration:
Termo543: ‘‘So I wonder if anyone could give me a description on what that might look like.’’
Ibanez: ‘‘Well, the human would probably fly to bits.’’

This

And you settle on MEGA PUKE? Like I said before, I wouldn’t post pictures of shit and or urine because I respect the fact that bodily ‘secretions’ can gross some people out. Puke grosses me out, it really wasn’t necessary, and you don’t need to fight the fact that it was.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Burbinator:

Since a point in space can’t be occupied by two things at the same time, I’d say it’s impossible.

Depends on what you mean by “point in space”. Solid matter is basically empty space on the atomic scale…

Read full topic

The pic I put up: link

And I support the whole swapping idea, that whatever was here goes there and there goes here… like the mini-tele in Kleiner’s lab.

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: Spooboy
item.description:
Losmoges:

You find this disgusting but you play a game where you blow people up into bloody bits…?

Ridiculous cencorship is ridiculous.

The pic I put up: link

Yeah, sure thing buddy. Some people are grossed out by puke, respect that fact and don’t post it. I wouldn’t go around posting pictures of shit and or urine for the fun of it. Not to mention it was spam and had nothing to do with the discussion; I’m glad it got censored.

By the way computer generated blood/gore is different from chunky puke on a close up lens. .

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Burbinator:

Since a point in space can’t be occupied by two things at the same time, I’d say it’s impossible.

Haven’t you ever seen that one episode of the X-Files where they visit area 51?

Anyway, isn’t an object mostly empty space? So the two objects would be able to exist in the spaces between each other’s atoms/molecules.

Jimps043:

In Kleiner’s lab in HL2, if I remember correctly, the mini-teleporter would swap two objects’ locations if they were on opposite platforms, so maybe the teleportations in Black Mesa did the same.

It would be kind of interesting if a scientist’s liver got swapped out for a houndeye. Of course, back wherever the houndeye came from, it would look as though it just turned into said scientist’s liver.

No, it only teleported from platform to the other. Would be interesting though. I don’t think a liver is that big, though.

Read full topic

It would be kind of interesting if a scientist’s liver got swapped out for a houndeye. Of course, back wherever the houndeye came from, it would look as though it just turned into said scientist’s liver.

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: eateroftheflame
item.description:
rx33gundam:

It was Nihilanth teleporting the Vorts, Agrunts and controllers right? What about the Headcrabs and houndeyes? Resonance cascade?

Yes the RC sent the first wave of aliens, after that the Nihilanth started sending more of them through the rift.

On the subject of this telefragging, maybe it would be like on The Fly, the human and the alien combine to form a hybrid (Freemancrab perhaps).

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
The way I see it, the random teleports sent aliens into low density areas, only occupied by gaseous matter. No telefragging or wall teleporting

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
I think Freeman’s Mind also mentioned aliens teleporting inside walls etc, which was one of the things making the place structurally unsound. That’d be interesting to see, too.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting Aliens
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
I guess it could be used for ONE scripted sequence. It could be interesting but the likelihood is very small so I don’t think it should happen more than once, if ever.

I’m sure Black Mesa won’t do it though, because it would add a new thing to the story.

Read full topic
